div.p: This wizard will configure the ABC (Activity-Based Costing) system for your business. It creates cost pools to group employee costs, cost drivers to allocate costs to clients, and service categories to organize your offerings.

field.name: setup_employees
field.help: Creates cost records for employees to track salaries, benefits, and hourly rates. Required for cost allocation calculations.

field.name: setup_pools
field.help: Groups employee costs by activity type (e.g. Hardware Support, Software Development). Each pool represents different work your company does.

field.name: setup_drivers
field.help: Defines how costs from pools are allocated to clients (e.g. per workstation, per user). Cost drivers determine the allocation basis for each pool.

field.name: setup_services
field.help: Creates service categories to organize your service catalog. Helps classify different types of services you offer.

Cost Drivers: Workstations, Users, Servers, Applications

You've selected custom setup. The wizard will only create employee cost records. You'll need to manually create:

ul.li: Cost pools that match your business activities
Cost drivers for allocating costs to clients
Service categories for your service catalog

Once the wizard completes, you can:

ul.li: Review and edit created cost pools and drivers
Assign employees to cost pools with time percentages
Set client cost driver values (e.g., number of workstations per client)
Create service catalog with ABC cost calculations

div.p: All items created by this wizard can be modified or deleted later.
